Column Comment.0: UWI: Unique identifier for a well.
Column Comment.1: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.2: CREW COMPANY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thecompany that runs this crew. Not all members of a crew may be employees, but maybe contractors or seconded to the crew by another company.
Column Comment.3: DETAIL OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique sequence number that allows more thanone record about a crew to be captured for every drill period.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BOOKED TIME ELAPSED: The number of hours booked by the crew member or thecrew during a reporting period.
Column Comment.7: CREW MEMBER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for abusiness associate who is a member of this crew.
Column Comment.8: CREW MEMBER NAME: Unvalidated field for the name of the crew member. If youwant to track crew member names from a validated list, please use CREW MEMBERBA ID.
Column Comment.9: CREW MEMBER NUMBER: Unvalidated field for the number of the crew member. Ifyou want to track crew member numbers from a validated list, please use CREWMEMBER BA and link to BA_ALIAS, where the alias type = CREW MEMBERNUMBER (or whatever you choose to call it).
Column Comment.10: CREW MEMBER RECORD INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this recordcontains information about an individual member of the crew.
Column Comment.11: EMPLOYEE POSITION: A reference table listing valid types of employee positions.This list may come from human resource departments.
Column Comment.12: CREW RECORD INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is forthe entire crew (a summary).
Column Comment.13: CREW REFERENCE NUMBER: a local reference number assigned to a crew or to acrew member for the purposes of bookeeping. Usually used for payroll purposes.Note that this information could also be stored in BA_ALIAS.
Column Comment.14: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.15: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.16: INJURY INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether an injury was recorded duringthis period. In the record for the crew, records whether any crew member wasinjured. For the record for an individual, records whether that individual was injured.For regulatory reasons, a separate flag is provided to confirm that an injury DID ocurrduring this period. This is more explicit than a single Y/N flag that covers bothcontingencies, as the N position may be ambiguous. In this case, a setting of Yindicates that an injury WAS recorded during this period (Yes, there were injuries).
Column Comment.17: INJURY INITIALS INDICATOR: A Y/N flag confirming that the crew member hasproperly initialed the well period reporting sheet that explicitly confirms whether or notthere was an injury. Typically, the crew member must initial a spot marked NOINJURY or another spot marked YES INJURY .
Column Comment.18: NO INJURY INDICATOR: For regulatory reasons, a separate flag is provided toconfirm that NO injury ocurred during this period. This is more explicit than a singleY/N flag that covers both contingencies, as the N position may be ambiguous. In thiscase, a setting of Y indicates that an injury was NOT recorded during this period(Yes, there were no injuries).
Column Comment.19: OVERHEAD COST: the cost associated with overhead, such as living costs.
Column Comment.21: CREW OVERHEAD TYPE: They type of overhead paid to a crew member during apeiod, such as cost of living allowance.
Column Comment.22: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.23: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.24: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: check constraint value that is used to maintain therelationship between SUPPORT FACILITY and its various sub-types.
Column Comment.25: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.26: SUBSISTANCE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether the crew or an individualon the crew qualified for a subsistance subsidy during this reporting period.
Column Comment.27: SUPPORT FACILITY IDENTIIER: Unique identifier for the support facility that thecrew is assigned to for this reporting period. Normally a vessel, but could be a campor other habitat.
Column Comment.28: TOTAL CREW COUNT: The total number in the crew during this reporting period.Only used for the record that represents the entire crew.
Column Comment.29: TOTAL INJURY COUNT: The total number of injuries recorded during this shift. Thiscolumn is only used in the record for the entire crew.
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
